case_vignette: A 72-year-old man presents to the clinic with an intensely itchy rash on his abdomen and chest that appeared 2 months prior. He denies starting any new medications prior to the onset of the eruption and any systemic symptoms. Although he traveled and stayed in hotels recently, he reports that his wife does not exhibit any similar symptoms. Physical examination reveals numerous discrete papules, crusted papules, and papulovesicles on the chest, abdomen, and mid-back. His upper and lower extremities, face, and groin are unaffected.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been dealing with a really itchy rash on my stomach and chest for about 2 months now.
Have you noticed any other symptoms such as redness, swelling, or pain in the affected areas?
The rash is made up of lots of small bumps, some with crusts and tiny blisters, but there's no pain or swelling, just a lot of itching.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or lifestyle?
No, I haven't started any new medications, and I haven't had any changes in diet.
Have you had any family members with similar symptoms?
No, my wife doesn't have any rash or similar symptoms.
Have you had any travel history recently?
Yes, I traveled recently and stayed in hotels.
Have you noticed any other symptoms such as fever, chills, or fatigue?
No, I haven't had any fever, chills, or feelings of tiredness.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin color or texture?
Just the rash with small bumps, some with crusts and tiny blisters on my skin, no other changes in color or texture.
Final Diagnosis: Contact Dermatitis.
